intro: Spermacoce rupicola, commonly known as rock spermacoce, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Arabian Peninsula. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are usually opposite and have a rough texture, often covered in fine hairs. Spermacoce rupicola thrives in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions.
